intro: Atragene columbiana f. albescens, commonly known as the white-flowered Columbian bellflower, is a rare and striking plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. This horticultural form is prized for its ornamental value and is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique appearance.
